formulas.raw: Volume formula (regular tetrahedron) \[ V = \frac{a^3}{6\sqrt{2}} \] Here \(a\) is the common edge length. If \(a\) is measured in meters, \(V\) is in cubic meters; if \(a\) is in centimeters, \(V\) is in cubic centimeters, and so on.
